comments.body: The only problem I think this idea has is that the player might be taught to break or not break all spawners, so there might need to be a distinct difference. Maybe they wouldn't look too similar.

Maybe the weker spawned will deactivate, and will only reactivate when a player leaves the chunk far enough to deactivate it in memory and then reactivate when a player comes back. That way the player can run through the dungeon, clearing it, but another player on the same server can do the same (if they don't break it of course). Going along with it, maybe each monster would spawn a piece of a chest that would be crafted together to make a chest with random loot, so a player can go through multiple runs or multiple players can go through it without the admin having to set the region to regenerate it's chunks.
Maybe on the weak mob spawner there is no strange  skull-bat-thingy on the side.
Yes after the emphasis on jungle temples went down we need to add something to make a trip there worthwhile.
Support. In a game the centres of power would be these building's. Currently you have to build it yourself, risking attack.

I think it would be a great idea to add a center where villagers trade all their goodies. It wont discourage the player to build one lately since it wont be that big and it will be an easy target for monsters

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: “Quicksand”

Text: “The same sand, but it will be slightly darker than normal and will pull you under itself, in the end causing damage from loss of air. If you step, it's impossible to get out. Found in the desert and along the coast. Quite rare. You can get it (with a shovel) and blow it up. Does not drop on explosion.”

- Translated by Admin.

Maybe they could have a chance to shine meaning they're enchanted with random effect like strength or slow falling etc. Also this would be an opportunity to make them available to build for the player like the iron golems.

Yes! This would be a great update with:
Soldiers that can be 'hired' (like taming) that will fight hostile mobs on sight or chosen players. Also they can 'guard' (like 'sit'), and will only attack from that position, or 'patrol' a nearby area.
A King (villager profession) with a throne/chair as the workstation. He/she sits down and moves arm authoritatively.
The Castle generates on a mountain/hill next to a village.
With villagers. Or a friendly mob that fights villager's enemies.
What about a doctor villager who trades good potions, golden apples and other items

i would of inclouded some traps!!!!
I really like this idea, I liked it so much that I got on to Pe and made it, I also like the traps idea so maybe make the chest trapped and leading to a dispenser with arrows(pictures bellow)
I feel like the galactic alphabet should be spouting out the middle.
Stonehenge was intended as a sort of calendar, but since there aren't shadows without shaders, it could just be a marker for excavation sites

Awesome idea! I think there should be a roof partially covering the staircase, so you only see the front and the staircase so you have to go down to find out what is there. There should be about a 10% chance of a chest not spawning. I think the stones should spawn at the same spawn rate as a woodland mansion. can't wait to see this added to the game!!!
This is actually a neat concept (in that it better integrates llamas into the game) but it adds a lot of new behaviors to villagers that are out of character.
This is a thought out idea. Thus, "going to village" is really helpful, its because its really hard to find village in your world without any tools or cheats.

I sort of like the idea.  I don't think any new items or entities should be added to the game, just for this though.  Also, caravans should just stick to one village because otherwise "village wreckers" could find villages more easily.

Depending on what items they are caring at the time, it's like the village comes to you! You could use this to learn where villages are and you could play the role of a bandit, llamas have storage and villagers should utilize it

It could be called a ship city with a collection of 3 to 8 ships. With at least one farmer, cartographers, and lots of fishers.
This has alot of possibilities and wats this could be amazing.

I like this idea. It could be floating, but it could also have stilt legs that go into the sea floor with boardwalks connecting them and docks for boats and larger (functional) ships. To contrast this though, there could be illager viarients that spawn like pirate coves where pirate ships can dock and can sail off to attack the player with cannons.

This sounds great, and I really like Elliander’s idea of contrasting Illager boats. My take on this is that, similar to the Woodland Mansions, there could be a Coastal Mansion with special Illagers that could sail and go attack the village. As much support as I can get goes to this idea!
This would absolutely wreck any setup that doesn't involve just trading in the natural spawned village...
No.  If you want an oversized village, build one.

i legit had this idere today XD

This is a really good idea, but I don't think the houses should look like those in the overworld because Piglins and Villagers are two very different races. The nether villages could look more like small wooden fortifications or nomadic camps than peaceful villages.

I agree completely with 396755137432 completely.

Other than that, I like this.

 

Verdict: I like this idea - rethink its design slightly and you will have earned a vote!
And make them plant nether fungus in their farms

Possibly these could generate with a small surrounding wall, or use warped fungi, to prevent attacks from Hoglins? Other things to keep in mind (that would force the villages to differ from overworld villages) is a Piglin's lack of access to glass, and the fact beds arent usable in the nether.

The only dislike I have with this suggestion is the village is for Piglins, who already spawn throughout the Nether. Why seek one of these villages out if there is nothing unique about its inhabitants? Does it have set inhabitants, or is it just filled on each visit by mob spawning? Having a Piglin Village may necessitate a Piglin Villager, unique to the village, as otherwise it provides little change in gameplay to the biome it generates in.
I think it is a great idea.
Even if these are not populated by Piglins, I would still love them! []~(￣▽￣)~*
This sounds way cool, but they should not be exactly the same as overworld villages.
They should maybe also form in basalt deltas.
Piglins, should definitely have homes and I agree that they should be in Crimson and Warped Villages.
There should be a respawn anchor instead of a bed in every house and windows with fungi of some type in the middle instead of glass.
What if the Villages were populated by Villagers who got stuck in the Nether and they had special crops for the Nether?

Yes! Just a few logs and chests around a campfire, with the richer ones having cover over the top, or banners. Also, somewhere it's been destroyed and the pillager flag has been hung, signifying a pillager rade destroyed it. Perhaps inside the main chest, there could be a map to wherever the travelers who owned it were going. These maps don't tell you where they lead, some go to villages, other woodland mansions or monuments.
Coll idea dude
Some, maybe 5% of them, could have villagers still living in them
Their abandoned no one is there and they could have a bunker with villagers in it.

I was actually going to post something like this. I'll post my idea here instead.

 

New structure: Abandoned Camp

Biome(s): Mesa/Badlands, Desert, Jungle, Savanna, some forest biomes

Use: collection of resources, temporary shelter

Description: The Abandoned Camp is a structure left behind by some adventurous group on a mission to explore the world. It consists of 1-5 ruined shelters and a campfire surrounded by logs to sit on. The campfire has a small chance of being lit or having food on it. The shelters can contain chests with loot similar to what you might find in villages. There is a chance to find logs, planks, sticks, coal, food, and very rarely, an emerald. They can also generate with tools up to iron. The wood used could be one of two things:

1) always oak

2) based on the biome, with oak for biomes with no trees

I haven't decided which is best.

 

I hope you appreciate my addition to this idea. I also agree that the biome a camp is in could affect the size and loot.

Cob webs in tents, and a extinguished campfire outside. 

What a awesome way to get a Base in one day for new players.
Yeah but how would they be dyed??? Using a dye on a portal doesn't make too much sense.

What about it also taking 64 white dye from bone meal to bleach. Then you have to dye it with a big # of dyes.

This an excellent idea, would help so many players.
Just had this realization in server chat. Yes, we need this!
Support for this idea. There are 10 + of these already. The cartographer could use new maps to sell. A map to the closest Ancient city is perfect. Like mansions they are hard to find if not harder.
Why does the cartographer sell banners that should be replaced by this new map
This is a fantastic idea but I think it would be really cool if you could find them in mansions as it seems the pillagers have already visited the ancient city

For any new structures there should be a way to map to it. This should expand to trail ruins, end cities, etc. These are all difficult things to find especially if you are unlucky with navigation. Another option for ancient cities though is an enchanted compass to lodestones in ancient cities would be a really unique way to find naturally spawned lodestones.
I really love the idea of the piglins trying to snipe you as you pass by.

Would the ballista on the watchtower be automatic? Or would it be operated by a piglin? If It were operated by a piglin, you could take out the piglin, but if it were automatic, then you could be shot down by your own ballista because it would automatically fire at you.
A Piglin Watchtower or like a Piglin Camp made of Stem Wood. Based on Bokoblin Camps from Breath of the Wild
Ok, ok, ok, WE NEED THIS!!! Maybe their could even be a Piglin chief or something like that inside! Everyone VOTE THIS IDEA! We need Mojang to see this!

This is an interesting idea, though I am not so sure about the ballista. My main problem with weapons like them is that they make fighting mobs a little too easy. Could there be some sort of mini-boss with a crossbow instead? It would definitely be interesting to have some sort of mob that could snipe at players.

There is a mod called repurposed structures that has them! They also have jungle fortresses (the same as the Nether one but in the jungle) they have villages for I think almost every biome type...swamps, jungles, etc. They also have piglin villages in the Nether for multiple biome types. Another thing is different types of mine shafts. Alternative shipwrecks and pyramids. Temples in biomes in the nether. Another cool thing is different spawner rooms depending on biome/mob! It’s an amazing mod that gives you more to explore without feeling like it’s ruining the vanilla feel of minecraft!
How about they are just seats, and what if some villages have an emerald on the top.
Yes, Emerald Cult! Also make different varieties of church that are not and are biome specific.

I don’t know. It might be too religious for Minecraft?

And I would never look at a villager the same way again.
how about if churches have their own organs,that will give the church a better music enviroment

Great idea i think the totem of light could be a weapon that does 6 damage and sets fire to the opponent and has to be relit a station called the soul lighter (found in the nether) which can be powered with a item called the soul collecter and you collect souls by killing things once powerd by souls the totem of light gets re lit after burning out ps: this gives me terreria vibes

I would say a miners helmet that grants light of a torch.  Appearance similar to Minecraft Dungeons Miners gear helmet. This gives a new armor just for mining vs new pickaxe.  Enchantment for ore detection is not bad at all and the new mob.  Other thing I like to see is the Mineshaft column itself with stairs or ladders going up/down to next level as one would see in actual mine since MC has no lifts.

367856517131 Combining yours and 399901402531’s ideas, I think that Umbra’s “Miner’s Vision” enchantment should be an enchantment only for the Miner’s Helmet, and there should be Miner’s Vision 1, 2, and 3, with each level increasing the range of your ore-seeking ability.  Here’s my own list of enchantment ideas:

Brightness 1-3 - Increases the light for the Miner’s Helmet. The higher the level, the brighter your helmet gets.

Sharp-eyed - Outlines nearby mobs in the mine, and indicates which blocks are silverfish-infested.

Arachno-resistant - Reduces damage from spiders by half, and allows you to walk through cobwebs without slowing down (useful for exploring Mineshafts)

 (I can’t think of a name for this one, help!) 1-5 - Increases the speed for mining stone by 25%, adds 5% every level
This would fit in better with the cave update instead of it having its own separate update.
DigitalDrei, regarding the name for the enchantment, it could be something like: Stoned Haste, Rock Pounder, Rocky Miner, Masonry Expert, etc..
399901402531 Those are really good names! Can you think of any alternate names for the "Arachno-resistant" enchantment?
Maybe something like: Cobweb Walker, Spider Division, Arachnid Explorer, Spiderhunter, Webbed Survival, Anti-Arachnid, Cobweb Resilience, etc.. (Do like Arachnid-resistant though)
Honestly, I would be happy if they just made them look better.
I just think they need more rooms to explore. Kind of like a stronghold, but smaller.

I like the idea, I think the desert temples get really boring after the first time you explore it fully, once you already died to the trap there is no more to see, I wanted the experience of finding a desert temple something new and challenging not boring and easy loot

Desert Temples need more variety. As you said, some could be bigger than others, containing different loot and also different traps alongside the TNT pressure plate, such as arrow dispensers, trapped chests, observers and mob spawners.
Temples of different sizes could be generated together in a cluster, like ocean ruins.
There could also be a giant and very rare variant with valuable loot, with the tradeoff of lots of traps around.
